Functions
Graph
function Graph(
canvasId,
lineColor,
yMin,
yMax,
dataCallback,
sampleIncrement = 3
)

This function handles the drawing of the curves. Inspired by HTML5: High Performance Real Time Graphing using Canvas and requestAnimationFrame

Parameters
canvasId

Contains the id of the HTML-Canvas, where the Graph is drawn in.

lineColor

Contains the correct lineColor for the Graph. This color is based on the VitalSign type.

yMin

Contains the minimum yValue of the Graph.

yMax

Contains the maximum yValue of the Graph.

dataCallback

Contains an Object-Reference that will start the corresponding dataCallback method to calculate the current VitalSigns values.

sampleIncrement

Is used to change the count of periods that are shown.

Variables
self
var self

Contains a reference to "this".

canvas
this.canvas

This variable contains a reference to the canvas.

context
this.context

This variable stors the context of the canvas.

xValue
this.xValue

Contains the current xValue in the chart.

yValue
this.yValue

Containt the current yValue in the chart.

valueDifference
var valueDifference

Stores the maximal difference for normalization of the curve heights.

play
var play

Indicates, is the chart is playing.

requestScaleUpdate
var requestScaleUpdate

Indicates, if a scale update is requested (Currently not used!).

pauseGraph
var pauseGraph

Indicates, if the current chart is paused. Charts are paused together.

needsReset
var needsReset

Indicates, if a reset of the chart is required. This is the case after the freeze of the graphs is revoked.

shouldClearGraph
var shouldClearGraph

Indicates, if the graph needs to be cleared.

now
var now

Contains the current date in milliseconds.

then
var then

Stores the previous time point?!

elapsed
var elapsed

Stores the elapsed time.

minmax
var yMinMax

This variable contains yMin and ymax value of the Graph. It is used in combination with updateScale and therefore not used currently.

Functions
updateScale
this.updateScale = function(
minVal,
maxVal,
isActive
)

This function is used to rescale the curves to fit into the drawing area. It is however currently not in use, because there is no adaption necessary.

normalizeY
this.normalizeY = function (
yValue
)

This function is used to normalizeY the transmitted yValue.

Parameters
yValue

This value contrains the yValue to be normalized.

Returns

The normalized yValue is returned.

draw
var draw = function ()

This function is used to draw the curves/pixels. It handels a lot of the necessary computations to draw the graphs.

start
this.start = function ()

This function is used to start the drawing of the charts and therefore the calculation of the corresponding vitalSign.

stop
this.stop = function ()

This function stops the repeated execution of the draw function.

pause
this.pause = function()

This function is used to pause the drawing of the graph.  The calculation of the current vitalSigns is however not paused.

clear
this.clear = function ()

This function is used to clear the Graph.

ETCO2Graph
function ETCO2Graph(
canvasId,
lineColor,
yMin,
yMax,
dataCallback
)

Used to initialize a ETCO2-specific Graph. See Graph for more information.

ECGGraph
function ECGGraph(
dataCallback
)

Used to initialize a ECG-specific Graph. See Graph for more information.

drawECGPeak
this.drawECGPeak = function ()

Draws the synchronization triangle over the ECG peak.

drawPacerPeak
this.drawPacerPeak = function()

Draws the vertical pacer line in the ECG.
